item.title: Abusing Cloud Identity Providers for Phishing
item.description: Many Cloud identity providers offer the ability to delegate authentication to an external identity providers. This is known as Federated authentication. This post focuses on providers that offer Federated passthrough authentication to on-premise directories such as Active Directory or LDAP. If implemented incorrectly on the provider’s side, on-premise passthrough authentication can be abused by threat actors to perform phishing attacks from the provider’s login page directly, under the attacker’s tenant / organization page.
